Building

Contents

  • Dependencies
  • The Makefile
    • Common Build Targets
  • Building Without the Makefile

Building#

The R2U2 static monitor as a static or shared library for use by user-developed programs, and includes an example CLI that can be used to run R2U2 specifications on the command line.

Dependencies#

The R2U2 monitor strives to minimize dependencies to ensure it can be targeted-at/ported-to as wide a variety of devices possible. A standard build of the included R2U2 monitor CLI as provided requires:

  • C99 std compiler (gcc or clang)

  • Posix environment (Linux, MacOS, Etc.)

  • Make

Note

The requirement for make can be worked around by manually configuring your own build system (see below) and the Posix file assumptions are primarily required the CLI in main.c and aren‚Äôt needed when used as a library, leaving only C99 compatibility as a hard requirement for deeply embedded contexts.

The Makefile#

The R2U2 static monitor includes a Makefile which automates the build process and caches results in the build directory.

Run ‚Äúmake help‚Äù for common build targets with sort descriptions.

Run ‚Äúmake list‚Äù for an uncommented list of all targets.

Common Build Targets#

bin

Builds build/r2u2, a CLI executable of R2U2 in release mode

debug

Builds build/r2u2_debug, a CLI executable of R2U2 with compile time warnings, runtime sanitizers, extra memory checks, and debug logging enabled

shared

Builds build/libr2u2.so, a shared object library of R2U2 in release mode

static

Builds build/libr2u2.a, a static archive of R2U2 in release mode

Building Without the Makefile#

If the provided Makefile cannot be integrated in your build environment, make sure to force your compiler into c99 standard compliance and define the POSIX flag _POSIX_C_SOURCE=200112L along with any feature flags needed by your application.
